#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Zandvoort
#Text=Zandvoort is as famous and crowded as beach resorts get in the Netherlands .

#Text=That is - in summer , when the weather is nice , Dutch and German visitors flock to the sandy beaches of this otherwise rather small town and dozens of beach pavilions along the long boulevard cater to their needs .
#Text=By November , all pavilions have to be closed and mostly removed until Mid-February , changing the face of the Zandvoort boulevard completely .
#Text=Apart from beach life , Zandvoort is known for the Circuit Park Zandvoort , the main car racing circuit in the country .
#Text=Although the last Formula 1 Dutch Grand Prix was held in 1985 , the circuit still has a range of other races to offer for racing fans .
#Text=Understand
#Text=The whole west coast of the Netherlands is a single long beach .
#Text=The nearest stretch to Amsterdam is Zandvoort — 29 minutes by train from Amsterdam Centraal , every 30 minutes .
#Text=In summer there are extra trains , change trains at Haarlem .
#Text=Zandvoort is very crowded on warm days in summer : parts of the beach attract the in-crowd , others the somewhat less so .
#Text=Get in
#Text=On hot summer days , traffic jams in the directions of all major Dutch beach destinations are common - and Zandvoort is no exception .
#Text=On such days , consider using the train instead of a car .
#Text=On other days , driving in is easy enough .
#Text=The N201 is the main road in , connecting Zandvoort to the nearby city of Haarlem and , slightly further , Amsterdam .
#Text=Trains run every half hour from Amsterdam and Haarlem , with extra trains in high season and on very hot ( and thus busy ) days .
#Text=From Amsterdam , it 's easy to connect to countless destinations in the country and abroad .
#Text=Station Zandvoort aan Zee is less than a 10 minute walk from the beach .
#Text=Bike lanes are readily available , and there are plenty of biking and hiking routes connecting Zandvoort to other beach resorts along the coast as well as to cities and villages in the region .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Zandvoort is a small place , so you can get around walking or rent a bike from one of the many bike rental stores in Zandvoort .
#Text=The nearest bike rental store to the train station is Zilt at Sea .
#Text=Zilt at Sea is also a few steps from the beach .
#Text=Zilt at Sea Bike Rentals in Zandvoort ( Rent a bike in Zandvoort at Zilt at Sea ) , Passage 33 , ☏ +31235766991 , ✉ info@ziltatsea.nl .
#Text=Rents bikes of all kinds , including electrical bikes , mountainbikes , tandems , scooters and children 's bikes .
#Text=You can also rent a locker , take a shower , and buy beach accessories .
#Text=See
#Text=Circuit Park Zandvoort , Burgemeester van Alphenstraat 108 , ☏ +31235740740 , fax : +31235740741 .
#Text=Events calendar .

#Text=Having served as one of the Formula 1 circuits from 1952 through 1985 , Zandvoort no longer meets the requirements for a Formula 1 race , though there still are plenty of championships and events held at Zandvoort to attend .
#Text=Most notable are the Testing Days , which you can register for in order to drive your own vehicle(s) on the circuit .
#Text=Juttersmu-Zee-um , Strandweg 2 , ☏ +31235712221 , ✉ info@juttersmuseum.nl .
#Text=A museum displaying what beachcombers find on the beaches of Zandvoort .
#Text=Free .
#Text=Do
#Text=Crowds flock here to find a spot on the sand and enjoy the sun and the sea .
#Text=Sunbathing , swimming , beach walks and of course casual drinks in one of the many beach side bars is the core of all activity here .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Zizo Sushi Lounge , Burgemeester van Fenemaplein 2 .
#Text=The sushi and sashimi in this restaurant get raving reviews , and they serve a nice range of cocktails too .
#Text=Staff is friendly and the atmosphere is modern but cosy .
#Text=€ 25 .
#Text=Strandpaviljoen Havana aan Zee , Boulevard Paulus Loot 1c ( Last beach pavilion on the Paulus Loot boulevard , south beach ) .
#Text=A pleasant beach pavilion with a classic menu and a good chef in the kitchen .
#Text=There are sandwiches , pizzas and salads for lunch and a regularly changing menu for diner , with lots of fish options .
#Text=When it 's too chilly to sit on the outdoor terrace , try to get a table at the window with views of the sea for the best experience .
#Text=In season , it 's usually open all day and serves breakfast , lunch and dinner .
#Text=In the evenings it 's a good spot for late drink .
#Text=Keep in mind that this place , like most beach pavilions , is closed from mid-October to mid-February and has flexible opening hours when the weather is bad .
#Text=Call ahead to be sure .
#Text=Café Restaurant Mollie & Co. , Haltestraat 75 , ☏ +31235718949 , ✉ info@mollieenco.nl .
#Text=Oud Zandvoortsch vischrest De Meerpaal , Haltestraat 61 , ☏ +31235712171 , ✉ info@restaurantdemeerpaal.nl .
#Text=Greek Cuisine Filoxenia , Haltestraat 49 , ☏ +31235734920 , ✉ kostas@filoxenia.info .
#Text=Eb & Vloed , Badhuisplein 2-4 , ☏ +31232010217 , ✉ info@restaurantebenvloed.nl .
